page.title: 08The Royal Pavilion
page.content: In 1750 Dr Russell published a book in which he announced a startling new discovery: dipping the body in salt water helped cure certain diseases. So a mad rush to the seabegan and the Prince of Wales, Prince Regent, joined the rush and came to Brighton. In 1785 he decided he wanted a little, simple cottage with his wife. But his life became less and less simple and he decided to have an architect add on buildings to his cottage. The architect, john Nash , liked the orient, so he put a mixture of Chinese, Japanese and Indian buildings were built. When Queen Victoria saw the pavilion, she was disappointed in it. But Brighton bought and preserved it. Now the building has been restored fully with the Oriental and Asian style.See it to believe it.
